column4: anyone knows about an option to add to nautilus fields of permissions etc. ?
what?
I want to see things like permissions in the list of files in nautilus.
If you need to install a package before you upgrade, use http://old-releases.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/
thanks
but again, you really ought to upgrade to 8.04 (and then might as well stick on LTS, since it seems to suit you)
after changing to old-releases, I don't have the pdftk package any more...
It should be an exact copy of the last state of the 7.10 mirrors
well, I did have pdftk before...
Change that from old-releases to releases
I'll try that, thanks
texlive-pstricks has pst-calendar, if that'll work for you.  But yes, sty files can be used by simply placing them in your working directory
yes, but packages should help me not doing that :) -- besides, why would one REMOVE them from a package, when they were already there?
Were they?  Let me look.
http://packages.ubuntu.com/de/intrepid/texlive-latex-extra -> http://packages.ubuntu.com/de/lucid/texlive-latex-extra

I'm looking at the changelog (http://changelogs.ubuntu.com/changelogs/pool/main/t/texlive-extra/texlive-extra_2009-7ubuntu3/changelog), (from 2007.dfsg.3-2 to present), and I can't see any notes about dropping those.
It might be an oversight, have you considered filing a bug?
sure, why not. Never done this before, though. Any tips before I'm starting?
ubottu just sent you a paragraph, the ReportingBugs page has some good info
thanks
and if you have questions, feel free to ask the channel
